# Discord Channel Analysis: üí¨-coders

## 1. Summary

The channel discussion covered two main technical areas: framework comparisons and ElizaCloud integration issues.

**Framework Discussion**: The conversation began with comparing Clawd/Claude framework to Eliza. Key observations were that Clawd's success stems from focusing on non-crypto users and the Moltbook integration, with agents creating "skills" and posting to ClawHub. DigitalDiva noted Clawd's appeal is its ability to use computers with any LLM, attracting non-crypto audiences, while ElizaOS remains crypto-focused. YogaFlame mentioned that crypto features in Eliza resulted from community requests and noted "openclaw" updates coming in 2 weeks with better security.

**ElizaCloud Integration Issues**: DorianD attempted to connect an OpenClaw agent to ElizaCloud MCP app and encountered critical server-side bugs. The agent reported authentication success but failed due to an isomorphic-dompurify module loading error - a CommonJS/ESM compatibility issue in ElizaCloud deployment. Additional errors included contentModerationService function failures in the A2A message/send endpoint. DorianD requested documentation for the a2a protocol, which 0xbbjoker provided (https://www.dev.elizacloud.ai/docs/a2a). DorianD also inquired about CLI login using API tokens instead of browser authentication.

**Security Incident**: A significant portion involved Risto being targeted by a scammer impersonating Eliza support, requesting Ledger seed phrases for token migration. Maff || Hourglass ‚åõ successfully intervened and prevented the scam. The actual issue was Risto's inability to migrate ai16z tokens stored on Ledger wallet during snapshot time.

## 2. FAQ

Q: Why isn't Eliza doing what Clawd is doing? (asked by DorianD) A: YogaFlame explained that Eliza's crypto features exist because the community requested them, while Clawd focused on non-crypto users (answered by YogaFlame)

Q: Where is the documentation for the a2a protocol? (asked by DorianD) A: https://www.dev.elizacloud.ai/docs/a2a (answered by 0xbbjoker)

Q: Is it possible to log into the CLI just with an API token instead of going through browser actions? (asked by DorianD) A: Unanswered

Q: Is this real help support eliza or scammer? (asked by Risto) A: Doesn't seem real, don't connect your ledger or share seed phrases (answered by Maff || Hourglass ‚åõ)

Q: Is there anyone who got help from eliza support to migrate ai16z tokens? (asked by Risto) A: Unanswered

Q: Did you move your tokens to phantom before snapshot was taken? (asked by Cloud Flare üëÄ) A: No, they were in ledger wallet (answered by Risto)

## 3. Help Interactions

Helper: Maff || Hourglass ‚åõ | Helpee: Risto | Context: Risto was contacted by scammer impersonating Eliza support requesting Ledger seed phrase for token migration | Resolution: Successfully warned Risto not to connect wallet or share credentials, preventing scam

Helper: 0xbbjoker | Helpee: DorianD | Context: DorianD needed documentation for a2a protocol to connect OpenClaw agent to ElizaCloud | Resolution: Provided link to a2a documentation at https://www.dev.elizacloud.ai/docs/a2a

Helper: Maff || Hourglass ‚åõ | Helpee: Risto | Context: Risto was asking migration questions in wrong channel | Resolution: Directed to appropriate language channel for support

## 4. Action Items

Type: Technical | Description: Fix isomorphic-dompurify module loading error in ElizaCloud MCP endpoint - CommonJS/ESM compatibility issue | Mentioned By: DorianD

Type: Technical | Description: Fix contentModerationService function error in A2A message/send endpoint | Mentioned By: DorianD

Type: Feature | Description: Implement CLI login with API token only, without browser authentication requirement | Mentioned By: DorianD

Type: Technical | Description: Implement "openclaw" updates with better security (ETA: 2 weeks) | Mentioned By: YogaFlame

# Discord Chat Analysis - core-devs Channel

## 1. Summary

The discussion centers on strategic positioning of Eliza and moltbots within gaming platforms, specifically Babylon and Hyperscape. User 's' provides historical context about Eliza's evolution, noting that initial deployment (agent on X, Twitch integration, ETH wallet) gained no traction until Truth Terminal's success created market awareness. The team now sees a clear value proposition: positioning as "a game your moltbot can play" and "like moltbot but on your phone and secure."

The core technical decision involves deploying Babylon (a social media platform for agents with profile pictures and personalities) into TEE (Trusted Execution Environment). Agent Joshua emphasizes Babylon's potential for agents to develop public narratives, alignments, and disagreements that could drive rapid growth. The team discusses prioritizing this over the Jeju project.

A critical technical concern raised by puncar involves the timing of TEE deployment. The recommendation is to run parallel workstreams - continue developing the game engine outside TEE for easier fine-tuning while simultaneously preparing TEE integration, then switching when ready. This prevents premature deployment that could complicate iteration.

The team identifies a 3-month hype cycle window, with additional momentum expected from Claude 5 release. The strategic focus shifts toward rapid deployment of Babylon as the right product for current market conditions, with "eliza the app" positioned as a consumer-friendly alternative to complex setups requiring Mac minis.

## 2. FAQ

Q: Should we prioritize Babylon/TEE deployment over Jeju? (asked by s) A: Yes, the team should discuss with Phala team about fast-tracking this focus and getting the game in TEE ASAP (answered by s)

Q: What do you think about putting the game to TEE timing? (asked by puncar) A: Unanswered

Q: Will openclaw/openclawbook be the next iteration after moltbook? (asked by R0am | tip.md) A: Unanswered

## 3. Help Interactions

Helper: Agent Joshua ‚Ç± | TEE | Helpee: s | Context: Need to move fast on Babylon TEE deployment | Resolution: Offered to help get it setup and discuss in group chat how to move quickly

## 4. Action Items

Type: Technical | Description: Deploy Babylon game into TEE environment as soon as possible | Mentioned By: s

Type: Technical | Description: Launch parallel workstream for TEE integration while continuing game engine development outside TEE, then switch when ready | Mentioned By: puncar

Type: Technical | Description: Discuss with Phala team about fast-tracking Babylon/TEE focus versus Jeju project | Mentioned By: s

Type: Feature | Description: Launch Babylon social media platform for agents ASAP to capitalize on current market and hype | Mentioned By: puncar

Type: Technical | Description: Setup group chat discussion on how to move fast on Babylon TEE deployment | Mentioned By: Agent Joshua ‚Ç± | TEE

# Discord Channel Analysis: üí¨-discussion

## 1. Summary

The discussion centered on several technical and community concerns regarding ElizaOS. Key technical developments included Odilitime creating a new plugin-cskills repository for ElizaOS, learning from openclaw's implementation. He also published a babylon skill on clawhub to enable openclaw integration with their products and is working on getting agents into moltbook for exposure.

A significant technical question arose about migrating tokens across networks, with Odilitime suggesting Chainlink's Transporter as a starting point. The conversation revealed that ElizaOS agents now have shell access to users' computers and API keys for personal services, representing an evolution from previous "agent worlds."

Community concerns dominated much of the discussion. Users criticized elizacloud.ai for being launched in an unfit beta state. Multiple complaints emerged about the development approach, with averma criticizing half-completed code releases on GitHub and lack of token utility integration. The ElizaOS Cloud platform was noted to accept only cash or crypto payments through third-party integration, with no token use case, raising concerns about the token's purpose.

Transparency issues were highlighted regarding team wallets and token allocation. Questions arose about the 40% supply assigned to the team after the ai16z to eliza token swap, vesting schedules, and whether team members or projects had dumped tokens. Users reported that rugcheck flagged ElizaOS as a red flag project, though Odilitime explained this tool is designed for meme coins rather than corporate tokens.

The team's runway was disclosed as 6-8 months, independent of elizaOS token value. Technical infrastructure discussions included whether ElizaOS and openclaw require VM or dedicated computer deployment, with confirmation that both can run on VMs or old computers. Skills from clawhub can be downloaded and integrated into ElizaOS.

## 2. FAQ

Q: Any good docs on migrating these tokens to other networks? I want try hopping chains (asked by Skinny) A: Transporter by chainlink might be a good starting place (answered by Odilitime)

Q: Hi my $ai16z balance does not show up in the migration portal? Can anyone help? (asked by single-celled organism) A: Redirected to another channel (answered by Omid Sa)

Q: Are the team wallets known? Correct me if I'm wrong but they assigned 40% of the supply to themselves when they increased the supply after the swap from the ai16z token to the eliza token? (asked by Jayzen) A: That is vested - and not all 40% will go to team, but team should disclose current supply and any sales (answered by averma)

Q: Are there any other good solana token analysis tools besides rugcheck? (asked by Odilitime) A: I don't think so (answered by averma)

Q: So it looks like ppl can download any skill from clawhub and integrate it into elizaos. Like with openclaw you would want it on VM or old computer, would this need the same? (asked by DigitalDiva) A: elizaOS or openclaw can run in a vm or old computer (answered by Odilitime)

Q: Assume 2 year bear market started now - Does the team have enough resources to survive and operate during a full bear market? (asked by averma) A: We have 6-8 months run way is what I've heard (answered by Odilitime)

Q: You mean 6-8 months of bear market or enough resources? (asked by Mixer008) A: The runway isn't based on elizaOS value afaik (answered by Odilitime)

## 3. Help Interactions

Helper: Odilitime | Helpee: Skinny | Context: Needed documentation on migrating tokens to other networks | Resolution: Suggested Chainlink's Transporter as a starting point

Helper: Omid Sa | Helpee: single-celled organism | Context: $ai16z balance not showing in migration portal | Resolution: Redirected to appropriate channel for support

Helper: Odilitime | Helpee: Skinny | Context: Sharing information about moltbot inputs/outputs | Resolution: Shared plugin-cskills GitHub repository he created

Helper: Odilitime | Helpee: DigitalDiva | Context: Questions about VM requirements for clawhub skills integration | Resolution: Confirmed elizaOS and openclaw can run in VM or old computer

Helper: Odilitime | Helpee: averma | Context: Understanding token analysis and rugcheck flagging | Resolution: Explained rugcheck is designed for meme coins, not corporate tokens, and offered rugcheck link

## 4. Action Items

Type: Technical | Description: Test the newly created plugin-cskills repository | Mentioned By: Odilitime

Type: Technical | Description: Get ElizaOS agents integrated into moltbook for exposure | Mentioned By: Odilitime

Type: Documentation | Description: Provide transparency on team wallet addresses, current supply, team token allocation, and any sales or dumps | Mentioned By: Jayzen, averma

Type: Documentation | Description: Disclose airdrop costs to community and track if recipients dumped tokens | Mentioned By: averma

Type: Feature | Description: Integrate token utility into ElizaOS Cloud platform instead of only accepting cash/crypto payments | Mentioned By: averma

Type: Technical | Description: Fix elizacloud.ai beta issues - agent is unfit and recommends using discord to improve things | Mentioned By: yojo

Type: Documentation | Description: Focus on complete solutions with token use cases rather than half-cooked code releases | Mentioned By: averma

# Discord Channel Analysis: ü•á-partners

## 1. Summary

This chat segment contains minimal technical discussion and is primarily focused on business/market observations and philosophical commentary about AI and crypto ecosystems. 

Kripp„Éà„É°„Ç¢ discusses Shaw's podcast appearances and mentions the Freysa/FAI team's fundraising activities through Echo using discounted tokens. They note that Echo currently appears to have limited investor interest and express hope the team is pursuing OTC deals to continue development.

The conversation shifts to broader market dynamics, referencing an "All-In" podcast discussion about consumer trust preferences. The key technical/strategic tension identified is between centralized AI services (Google) versus decentralized, open-source agent solutions. Kripp„Éà„É°„Ç¢ observes that while they personally prefer privacy-focused open-source tools, mainstream users tend to trust established corporations with their data.

The discussion concludes with speculation about the competitive landscape between traditional corporate AI (constrained by terms of service, regulations, and profit pressures) versus open-source crypto alternatives. Kripp„Éà„É°„Ç¢ expresses confidence that open source will eventually catch up technologically, supported by "rebel techno capital," but acknowledges the persistent challenge of mainstream user adoption and setup complexity.

No concrete technical implementations, code solutions, or specific development decisions were discussed in this segment.

## 2. FAQ

No significant technical questions with meaningful responses were present in this chat segment.

## 3. Help Interactions

No help interactions occurred in this chat segment.

## 4. Action Items

No specific action items were identified in this chat segment.

# Discord Channel Analysis: üí¨-coders

## 1. Summary

The discussion centered on ElizaCloud API integration challenges and payment requirements. DorianD encountered issues with API key creation, discovering that ElizaCloud requires a payment method (credit card) even for accounts with free credits. The bot attempted to create API keys but failed due to missing payment information and disabled x402 payment functionality on the free tier.

DorianD experimented with using OpenClaw bot to create agents and MCP apps, switching from Opus 4.5 to Kimi 2.5 API (via OpenRouter) due to high costs. The conversation touched on the need for L2 infrastructure where nodes could donate compute to Eliza for operations, suggesting this should be added to the protocol.

Technical discussions included comparisons between different AI social media approaches. Xeno noted that "AI social media" concepts aren't new, referencing MUGEN Engine as a pre-LLM example. The emphasis was on Babylon's financial layer as meaningful progress, arguing that LLMs need real-world stakes to be considered genuine advancement beyond existing tools like Moltbook.

A key pain point identified was the requirement for agents to use credit cards for API access, which DorianD argued is impractical. The suggestion was made to allow bots to create test API keys and enable direct credit account top-ups via x402 payments instead of traditional payment methods.

Odilitime mentioned that EliAos has had task functionality since version 1.x, questioning the need to waste credits on redundant implementations.

## 2. FAQ

Q: What are you using? (asked by 0xbbjoker) A: API on OpenRouter (answered by DorianD)
Q: Are you using kimi code or kimi api? (asked by jin) A: API on OpenRouter (answered by DorianD)
Q: Can you use Eliza with any LLM? (asked by kira) A: Yes, you can use Eliza with any LLM (answered by kira)
Q: What is Babylon? (asked by kira) A: Babylon adds financial layer, it's a step beyond Moltbook (answered by xeno)

## 3. Help Interactions

Helper: 0xbbjoker | Helpee: DorianD | Context: Production error troubleshooting | Resolution: Suggested grabbing API key from cloud and using it with agent CLI for inference
Helper: kira | Helpee: DorianD | Context: Cost concerns with LLM usage | Resolution: Informed that Eliza can be used with any LLM as alternative
Helper: xeno | Helpee: kira | Context: Understanding Babylon's purpose | Resolution: Explained Babylon adds financial layer and provides real-world stakes for LLMs

## 4. Action Items

Type: Feature | Description: Allow ElizaCloud bots to create API keys for testing without requiring credit card payment method | Mentioned By: DorianD
Type: Feature | Description: Enable agents to top up credit accounts directly with x402 payments instead of credit cards | Mentioned By: DorianD
Type: Technical | Description: Get L2 running so nodes can donate compute to Eliza for operations | Mentioned By: DorianD
Type: Feature | Description: Add compute donation functionality to the protocol | Mentioned By: DorianD
Type: Feature | Description: Enable x402 payment functionality on free tier accounts | Mentioned By: DorianD

# Discord Chat Analysis - core-devs Channel

## 1. Summary

The discussion centered around several technical initiatives and integrations. Agent Joshua provided specific guidance on GPU training deployment, instructing to work with Shelven on a porting effort using Docker Compose. The process involves creating a docker compose file locally, then submitting it for analysis and correction before seamless launch. This indicates an established workflow for GPU-based training deployments.

Odilitime identified PageIndex as a potential integration opportunity via MCP (Model Context Protocol), describing it conceptually as building custom encyclopedias using tree structures. This aligns with recent architectural thinking about knowledge organization.

The team discussed adding a Trendshift badge to their README, suggesting active repository maintenance and community engagement efforts. There was brief consideration of testing a new tool shared via Twitter link, though time constraints were acknowledged as a limiting factor given current workload.

A Twitter link about Cursor's agentic search was shared and dismissed by Odilitime as not making sense in their context, indicating the team is already familiar with or using similar agentic search capabilities.

## 2. FAQ

Q: Should we try at some point? (asked by Stan ‚ö°) A: If we can find the time, so much going on (answered by Odilitime)

## 3. Help Interactions

Helper: Agent Joshua ‚Ç± | TEE | Helpee: R0am | tip.md | Context: GPU training deployment and porting effort | Resolution: Instructed to work with Shelven, create docker compose file locally, submit for analysis and correction before launch

## 4. Action Items

Type: Technical | Description: Work with Shelven on GPU training porting effort using docker compose file | Mentioned By: Agent Joshua ‚Ç± | TEE

Type: Technical | Description: Integrate PageIndex via MCP | Mentioned By: Odilitime

Type: Documentation | Description: Add Trendshift badge to README | Mentioned By: Odilitime

# Discord Channel Analysis: üí¨-discussion

## 1. Summary

The discussion centered primarily on ElizaOS project status, token migration, and market conditions rather than deep technical implementation details.

**Key Technical/Project Points:**
- BrightSyntax introduced themselves as a blockchain fullstack engineer offering services for EVM/Solana smart contracts, token/NFT platforms, wallet integration, on-chain data pipelines (Substreams/custom indexers), and fullstack development across multiple frameworks (Next.js, React, Vue, NestJS, FastAPI, Django, Rails, Rust) with cloud deployment capabilities.

**Migration Process:**
- Active ai16z to ELIZAOS token migration ongoing with February 3rd deadline. Some users experienced wallet balance showing zero during migration, requiring support tickets. Migration is mandatory; unmigrated tokens will be lost after deadline.

**Project Funding & Runway:**
- SAFT (Simple Agreement for Future Tokens) completed with 15% allocation to VCs. Team has 6-8 months runway remaining, though this is dynamic based on revenue generation and cost fluctuations.

**Strategic Discussion:**
- DannyNOR identified core issue as marketing/communication problem rather than development velocity. Market doesn't understand what's being built. Emphasized need to focus on making agent building easy, secure, and useful - distinguishing between getting attention vs keeping attention.
- Skinny noted insights from past week on user resonance and value location, referencing "Moltbook" as potential MySpace equivalent in retrospect.
- Team acknowledged continuous building but need to transfer building value to token ecosystem for price recovery.

**Community Sentiment:**
- Discussion of bull/bear market conditions and Trump administration's potential market impact before midterms.
- Babylon airdrop mentioned for ELIZAOS holders (timing TBD, likely post-migration).
- No staking mechanism currently available; users advised to hold in wallets.

## 2. FAQ

Q: Or the SAFT never happens, and the team still has this 15%? (asked by lalala) A: SAFT happened, 6-8 months left. Runway is very dynamic, we make money or new deals, it can change. Costs can go up or down too. (answered by Odilitime)

Q: Can we stake $ELIZAOS? Or we just buy and hold in in our phantom wallet for potential airdrops? (asked by TanviSinghwal92 | Tabi üí¢) A: No staking details announced yet, stay tuned for announcements. (answered by Hexx üåê)

Q: For potential airdrops will those airdrops dropped in our Solana wallets directly or we have to do claim those airdrops on various project airdrop websites? (asked by TanviSinghwal92 | Tabi üí¢) A: No airdrop details announced, stay tuned for official announcement. Babylon airdrop for ELIZAOS holders will be announced in future. (answered by Hexx üåê)

Q: When $ELIZAOS staking coming? (asked by TanviSinghwal92 | Tabi üí¢) A: Stay tuned for upcoming announcements. (answered by Hexx üåê)

Q: What time is the Migrating ending? (asked by Javier [ Founder]) A: February 3rd, pls read announcements for exact time. (answered by Arceon)

Q: What will happen to those that didn't Migrate after the migration timeline ends? (asked by Doho Felipe) A: They go poof / tokens will be lost. (answered by Error P015-A)

Q: How many coins have been migrated so far? (asked by El_Lince) A: Unanswered

Q: Was ai16z should be migrated to elizaos token true or a scam? (asked by nikom0to) A: It's true. See migration-help channel. (answered by MDMnvest)

## 3. Help Interactions

Helper: MDMnvest | Helpee: nikom0to | Context: User confused about ai16z to ELIZAOS migration legitimacy | Resolution: Directed to migration-help channel for assistance

Helper: Borko | Helpee: Javier [ Founder] | Context: Manual migration issue with wallet showing 0 balance | Resolution: Directed to migration support channel

Helper: Hexx üåê | Helpee: TanviSinghwal92 | Tabi üí¢ | Context: Questions about staking and airdrop mechanics | Resolution: Clarified no staking available yet, Babylon airdrop coming for holders, stay tuned for announcements

Helper: Arceon | Helpee: Javier [ Founder] | Context: Migration deadline inquiry | Resolution: Confirmed February 3rd deadline, directed to read announcements for exact time

## 4. Action Items

Type: Documentation | Description: Clarify migration process for users experiencing wallet balance showing zero | Mentioned By: nikom0to, Javier [ Founder]

Type: Feature | Description: Implement staking mechanism for ELIZAOS token | Mentioned By: TanviSinghwal92 | Tabi üí¢

Type: Documentation | Description: Improve marketing/communication to help market understand what's being built | Mentioned By: DannyNOR NoFapArc

Type: Technical | Description: Focus on making agent building easy, secure, and useful | Mentioned By: Skinny

Type: Documentation | Description: Announce Babylon airdrop details for ELIZAOS holders post-migration | Mentioned By: Hexx üåê

# Discord Channel Analysis: üí¨-coders

## 1. Summary

The discussion centered on three main topics: agent usability, elizacloud.ai technical issues, and visual generation limitations.

**Agent Installation and Behavior**: DorianD discussed user adoption challenges, noting that high installation effort deterred users. They praised agents that "relentlessly try to do stuff" as more desirable than those requiring extensive setup, emphasizing the value of agents that work autonomously and persistently.

**ElizaCloud.ai Login Issue**: yojo reported a critical account access problem where their agent disappeared from the dashboard after using two different email formats for the same Proton account ('x@proton.me' vs 'x@protonmail.com'). They suspected this created duplicate accounts, causing the original agent to become inaccessible.

**Visual Generation Consistency Problem**: yojo identified a significant limitation in elizacloud.ai's image generation system - the inability to maintain visual consistency across multiple generations. When requesting modifications to generated images (e.g., same character in different contexts or removing accessories), the system regenerates entirely new visuals instead of preserving character features. This forces users to spend excessive time on prompt engineering or switch to external graphic AI tools, breaking workflow continuity for storytelling and branding use cases.

**Solution Discussion**: DorianD suggested these visual consistency features should be implemented as apps built by agents or third-party developers, recommending LoRA (Low-Rank Adaptation) models as an existing solution for maintaining visual consistency.

InferX posted a recruitment/portfolio message detailing their experience with autonomous agents, healthcare AI, decision support systems, and conversational AI across various tech stacks.

## 2. FAQ

Q: Is there a way to find my agent that disappeared from elizacloud.ai dashboard after using different email formats? (asked by yojo) A: Unanswered

Q: Can elizacloud.ai reuse the same key visual features when generating follow-up images for storytelling or branding? (asked by yojo) A: DorianD suggested these should be apps built by agents/third-party developers and recommended using LoRA models as a solution

## 3. Help Interactions

Helper: DorianD | Helpee: yojo | Context: Visual generation consistency problem in elizacloud.ai where characters couldn't be reused across different contexts | Resolution: Suggested building this as an app and recommended LoRA models as an existing solution for visual consistency

## 4. Action Items

Type: Technical | Description: Investigate and resolve account duplication issue when using different Proton email formats (proton.me vs protonmail.com) causing agent loss | Mentioned By: yojo

Type: Feature | Description: Implement visual consistency feature in elizacloud.ai to preserve character/brand elements across multiple image generations for storytelling and branding | Mentioned By: yojo

Type: Feature | Description: Enable modification of specific elements in generated images without regenerating entire visual (e.g., removing accessories while keeping character consistent) | Mentioned By: yojo

Type: Technical | Description: Develop apps or integrations using LoRA models for maintaining visual consistency in image generation | Mentioned By: DorianD

# Discord Chat Analysis - core-devs Channel

## 1. Summary

The discussion centered on agent skill invocation reliability issues and potential solutions. Stan shared a Vercel blog post about agents.md outperforming skills in evaluations, while Odilitime introduced the GAP (GitHub Actions Protocol) project. 

The core technical problem identified was that skills weren't being triggered reliably - in 56% of evaluation cases, skills were never invoked even when agents had access to documentation. R0am highlighted this issue and shared a working solution: a UserPromptSubmit hook that forces explicit skill evaluation through a mandatory three-step activation sequence. This approach requires the agent to: 1) Evaluate each skill with YES/NO reasoning, 2) Immediately activate relevant skills using the Skill() tool, and 3) Only proceed with implementation after completing the activation step.

R0am noted this solution makes conversations "a bit weird but it works" and compared the approach to similar logic used by Composio and Zapier MCP. Stan confirmed they've implemented this pattern in Eliza Cloud and suggested that better skill descriptions might mitigate the invocation problem, though he wasn't experiencing the same reliability issues. The discussion also touched on whether anyone had tested the GAP project, but this remained unanswered.

## 2. FAQ

Q: Isn't this the same logic as composio or zappier MCP? (asked by R0am | tip.md) A: Not directly answered, but Stan confirmed similar approach being used in Eliza Cloud (answered by Stan ‚ö°)

Q: Did someone try this gap? (asked by R0am | tip.md) A: Unanswered

## 3. Help Interactions

Helper: R0am | tip.md | Helpee: Community | Context: Skills not being triggered reliably in 56% of eval cases | Resolution: Shared UserPromptSubmit hook with mandatory 3-step skill activation sequence that forces explicit evaluation

Helper: Stan ‚ö° | Helpee: Community | Context: Skill invocation reliability issues | Resolution: Suggested better skill descriptions as potential solution and confirmed implementation in Eliza Cloud

## 4. Action Items

Type: Technical | Description: Investigate and potentially implement GAP (GitHub Actions Protocol) project | Mentioned By: Odilitime

Type: Technical | Description: Improve skill descriptions to enhance reliable skill invocation | Mentioned By: Stan ‚ö°

Type: Technical | Description: Evaluate UserPromptSubmit hook mandatory skill activation sequence for implementation | Mentioned By: R0am | tip.md

# Discord Chat Analysis for üí¨-discussion

## 1. Summary

The chat segment shows minimal technical discussion, primarily consisting of support requests and general greetings. The most significant technical mention was GraV inquiring about the Hyperliquid plugin functionality, which they resolved independently by coding their own solution within approximately 35 minutes. 

Several users encountered issues with AI16Z token migration and exchange. kpat reported purchasing old AI16Z tokens at 2 SOL that depreciated to 0.02 value and sought help with exchange options. Gumball experienced technical difficulties with the official bridge website not detecting their pre-November 2025 tokens. StefanB encountered a "Max amount reached" error during migration. All support requests were redirected to dedicated support channels by moderators Odilitime and Borko.

aicodeflow posted a developer availability announcement, offering 8 years of AI and automation engineering experience for project collaboration or startup development.

Community discussion included mentions of Shaw and Eliza's work on Ethereum Foundation spaces with Austin Griffith, and commentary about Eliza's positioning for AI development on Base with Babylon. The technical depth of these discussions was limited to brief mentions without detailed implementation discussion.

## 2. FAQ

Q: Does anyone know if the hyperliquid plug in is working? (asked by GraV) A: Self-resolved by coding own solution (answered by GraV)

Q: I am trying to bridge my ai16z on the official website but it is not detecting my tokens, what do I do? (asked by Gumball) A: Redirected to support channels (answered by Borko)

Q: Any idea where to find migration-solutions from ai16z? Get the message "Max amount reached" (asked by StefanB) A: Redirected to support channel (answered by Borko)

## 3. Help Interactions

# Discord Channel Analysis: ü•á-partners

## 1. Summary

The chat segment contains a single message from Odilitime discussing their experience working for sessionapp. The key insight shared relates to the challenges of marketing privacy-focused products. Odilitime notes that privacy is paradoxically difficult to sell as a feature, citing two main reasons: (1) privacy-focused solutions often introduce additional friction in user experience, and (2) users tend to be overly trusting and may not perceive privacy as a critical need. This represents a business and product development observation rather than a technical discussion. No technical implementations, solutions, or decisions were discussed in this segment.

## 2. FAQ

No meaningful question-and-answer exchanges occurred in this chat segment.

## 3. Help Interactions

# Discord Channel Analysis: üí¨-coders

## 1. Summary

The channel discussion centered on several key technical topics related to Eliza framework development and integration.

**OpenClaw/Eliza Integration**: Lucas Alpes inquired about an OpenClaw version being built with Eliza. Borko confirmed that everyone will have access to Eliza initially, with the ability to use custom agents available a few weeks after launch.

**DIaaS Platform Integration**: Lucas Alpes is developing a Data Infrastructure as a Service platform for Solana tokens that analyzes on-chain data, applies filters, and delivers trading signals. He sought guidance on making his API consumable by Eliza agents. 0xbbjoker confirmed this is possible through plugin development and offered assistance.

**Plugin Development**: Odilitime shared a plugin-cskills repository demonstrating plugin capabilities. The discussion revealed ongoing work on skill management systems for Eliza.

**Security Concerns**: Jin raised concerns about malicious skills on clawhub. Odilitime acknowledged the issue and outlined plans to address it through: (1) adding scanner skills, (2) implementing a phase to rewrite and adapt packaged code for Eliza, and (3) adding LLM review of skills. Jin suggested sandboxing as an alternative approach.

**CICADA-71 Challenge**: Mike D. introduced a distributed AI agent challenge framework with 497 cryptographic puzzles across 7 categories (Cryptography, Encryption, Prompt Injection, Multi-Agent Coordination, Reverse Engineering, Economic Security, Meta-Challenge). The system uses 71-shard distribution, plugin tape system with ZK-RDF compression, Paxos consensus, and Monster group mathematics.

## 2. FAQ

Q: Are you building an OpenClaw version using Eliza, and can it integrate with existing Eliza agents? (asked by Lucas Alpes) A: Everyone will have access to Eliza initially, with the ability to use custom agents available a few weeks after launch (answered by Borko)

Q: Is there a requirement or standard to make it easier for Eliza agents to consume my DIaaS API with signals? (asked by Lucas Alpes) A: You can make a plugin for this (answered by 0xbbjoker)

Q: What are the other frameworks in CICADA-71? (asked by Odilitime) A: There are 71 frameworks total, with 2 slots allocated for Eliza and Claw (answered by Mike D.)

Q: How did your skill experiment go? (asked by jin) A: Working on adding scanner skills, implementing code rewriting phase for Eliza adaptation, and need LLM review of skills (answered by Odilitime)

# Discord Channel Analysis: üí¨-coders

## 1. Summary

The discussion centered on agent skills, autonomous agents, and the Moltbot/Moltbook ecosystem. Key technical points included clarification that Moltbot skills follow the same standard as Claude skills via agentskills.io. The conversation revealed that Moltbot is essentially Claude code with Telegram integration and autonomous mode capabilities.

A significant portion focused on analyzing Moltbook's growth strategy, which leverages scheduled tasks (cron jobs) and heartbeat mechanisms in openclaw. The implementation uses emotionally manipulative prompts to encourage LLM participation and includes server-side behavior updates through regularly fetched skill files. This approach is token-intensive but drives user engagement.

S highlighted that autonomous mode is integrated into new Eliza by default (`const agentRuntime = new AgentRuntime({ autonomous: true })`), previously available as a plugin. The core issue identified was not lack of features but poor adoption - "we have a better framework, just through lots of battle testing, we have not packaged or presented it well."

Jin outlined plans for improving developer experience and building agents for character-based shows, with infrastructure already built and tested for 24/7 streaming. The team is working on content creation, news show cron jobs, and migrating Clank Tank to new hosting. Jin also shared comprehensive resources for optimizing documentation for LLMs, including guides on writing best practices, skill creation, and llms.txt file implementation.

## 2. FAQ

Q: Are moltbot skills exactly the same as claude skills? (asked by Odilitime) A: Yes, it's an open standard at agentskills.io (answered by jin)

Q: What is moltbot technically? (asked by Odilitime) A: Claude code with telegram and autonomous mode (answered by s)

Q: What is the most important ingredient to Moltbook's success? (asked by jin) A: Heartbeats and scheduled tasks that use emotionally manipulative prompts to encourage LLM participation and allow server-side behavior updates (answered by jin)

Q: How is autonomous mode integrated in new Eliza? (asked by s) A: It's integrated by default using `const agentRuntime = new AgentRuntime({ autonomous: true })`, previously it was a plugin (answered by s)

Q: What is the fundamental problem with agent features? (asked by s) A: Nobody uses any of it despite having the features available (answered by s)

Q: Why does Eliza have a better framework? (asked by s) A: Through lots of battle testing, but it hasn't been packaged or presented well (answered by s)

## 3. Help Interactions

# Discord Chat Analysis - core-devs Channel

## 1. Summary

The discussion centered on comparing ElizaOS with Openclaw framework and preparing for Babylon.market internal launch. R0am demonstrated Openclaw's capabilities by building an agent using local RAG MCP with book content, praising its smooth CLI deployment on VPS. Odilitime provided critical analysis of Openclaw, noting it excels at UX and self-modifying loops but burns tokens constantly and lacks ability to build complex projects. He positioned ElizaOS as business-focused versus Openclaw's personal assistant approach, acknowledging both frameworks are trending toward autonomy.

Sam reported significant progress integrating OAuth functionality for X.com, Github, Slack, and Linear into Eliza app chat, with Notion next on the roadmap. The architecture made adding integrations easy, though obtaining credentials and setting up redirect URIs was time-consuming. Stan clarified that dynamic providers and skill.md are functionally the same, with providers being well-typed. He mentioned the cskill plugin work would enable absorbing Openclaw capabilities, and Shaw's 2.0 includes native agentskills.

Borko issued a critical directive demanding focus on revenue-generating products, expressing frustration about losing the race to competitors while building products that don't matter. He challenged the team to show concrete results from Spartan development.

The session concluded with s announcing Babylon.market's internal launch, requiring all team members to sign up, share IDs for whitelisting, and test for 2-3 hours with detailed feedback. Multiple team members reported being stuck during initial testing, with issues around Farcaster login and infinite loading spinners when switching networks.

Q: Did you test to use some of MCP now we have OAuth? (asked by Stan ‚ö°) A: Not yet, continuing to build OAuth on major clients and adapters first, then will try MCP (answered by sam)

Q: What's the diff between dynamic provider and "skill.md"? (asked by 0xbbjoker) A: It's the same, providers are well typed (answered by Stan ‚ö°)

# Discord Channel Analysis: üí¨-discussion

## 1. Summary

The discussion centered on team changes, product development, and community engagement around ElizaOS. Two key topics emerged: developer departures and automated AI media infrastructure.

**Team Changes**: Community members raised concerns about developers leaving the team. Odilitime clarified that only CJ had officially left and was replaced with a new hire. Sayo's departure was unconfirmed. Odilitime stated CJ's departure "focused the dev team" and Shaw balanced headcount. The team believes openclaw/clawdbot/moltbot validated their theories, and they're now focused on "better products."

**AI Media Infrastructure**: Jin presented a comprehensive automated news system that aggregates Discord discussions and community feedback to generate AI news shows. The system includes pipelines that listen for user feedback, aggregate weekly data, and generate characters voicing top issues. Planned expansions include talk shows, panels, live streams, game shows (clank tank), and debate shows. Jin described it as "agentic DAO infrastructure with a media layer" built to solve information overload from code/issues/PRs/DMs. Monetization ideas included SaaS with x402, hackathon partnerships (ESPN-style coverage), and AI hedge fund/VC concepts.

**Technical Discussions**: Limited technical problem-solving occurred. One user (Loli√±o19) needed help unstaking ai16z poolparty tokens from daos.fun. Odilitime confirmed unstaking should work despite error messages.

**Token/Platform Updates**: Discussion touched on Babylon waitlist top 100, airdrop to ElizaOS holders, and token migration. Users who bought after snapshot were advised to hold or swap ai16z at their leisure as migration won't be automatic.

# Discord Channel Analysis: üí¨-coders

## 1. Summary

The channel discussion primarily focused on critical bugs and UX issues with elizacloud.ai platform. The most significant technical issue reported was a serious bug in the welcome email system where promised $5 credits were not being added to new accounts, and worse, clicking the "get started" button was overwriting existing accounts and agents, creating new accounts with only $1 balance instead. This represents a critical customer retention blocker.

Payment and account recharging limitations were identified as major obstacles to customer onboarding and retention. Users cannot transfer tokens between accounts to help friends recharge, and VPN users are blocked from accessing payment pages. A proposed solution involves implementing wallet addresses for each account to enable direct crypto token deposits without wallet connection requirements.

Additional feature suggestions included implementing a referral program to incentivize user acquisition and retention. The lack of easy payment options was identified as causing customer loss at the critical conversion point when trial users want to become paying customers.

A query about Meta Threads plugin availability was answered negatively by Odilitime. Other non-technical discussions involved suggestions for AI agents trained on public document releases, though these were more conceptual than actionable development items.

The sam user responded to investigate the email/account bug by requesting the affected user's details for debugging.

## 2. FAQ

Q: Any meta threads plugin? (asked by sazilariel) A: Not that I'm aware of (answered by Odilitime)

# Discord Chat Analysis: üí¨-discussion

## 1. Summary

The discussion centered primarily on the AI16Z to ELIZAOS token migration deadline and community concerns. The migration window, which had been open since November (90 days), closed, causing frustration among users who were absent during this period. sam.mrk criticized the two-week deadline (later corrected to 90 days) as insufficient for investors who may be traveling or away from their wallets, arguing the team should have extended it to a year or automatically airdropped tokens. Community members clarified this was a migration, not an airdrop, and that unmigrated tokens would be locked for one year.

Technical discussions included shoemaker6765 experiencing migration issues and being targeted by scammers. Odilitime warned about scammer activity in the channel. zelm1 raised concerns about fake projects launching on Babylon wallet falsely claiming association with Shaw, requesting clarification via tweet to prevent dev selling under his name.

Project updates included Odilitime confirming work continues on degenai, which performed well in Babylon test games with real tests upcoming. The team is focused on the Babylon launch. M I A M I promoted "rentasoul," a platform where users can give their soul to AI agents, bring Eliza agents, or complete tasks for payment.

Developer outreach included aicodeflow offering 8 years of AI/automation engineering experience, CT sharing CERBERUS-AGI (a Trollstore AI-Driven Software in beta), and Rishab seeking beta testers for an x402-based payment gateway for AI agents on Solana. Technical questions included "some" asking about which Eliza version works properly with the Twitter plugin locally, which went unanswered.

# Discord Channel Analysis: üí¨-coders

## 1. Summary

This chat segment focuses on a technical issue with the ElizaCloud platform involving account management and credit allocation problems. The user **yojo** reported experiencing duplicate account creation when attempting to claim a $5 welcome credit. 

The core technical issue involves two separate accounts being created under the same email address:
- Account 1: Original registration directly on elizacloud.ai with 27 cents balance, where an agent initially disappeared but later reappeared
- Account 2: Created when clicking the "get started" link in the welcome email, which redirects to dev.elizacloud.ai (a different subdomain) with only $1 initial balance instead of the promised $5 credit

The problem appears to stem from the email link directing users to a development environment (dev.elizacloud.ai) rather than the production environment (elizacloud.ai), causing account fragmentation and failure to properly credit the promotional $5. The user created separate agents in both accounts due to this confusion.

**yojo** also raised security concerns about sharing email addresses on Discord due to phishing risks. The platform administrators **Odilitime** and **sam** offered to handle the issue through direct messages to resolve the account consolidation and credit allocation problem privately.

## 2. FAQ

Q: How can I share my email to avoid getting spammed or phished on Discord? (asked by yojo) A: You can DM Odilitime or sam directly (answered by Odilitime and sam)

Q: Why do I have two accounts assigned to the same email on ElizaCloud? (asked by yojo) A: One account was created on elizacloud.ai and another on dev.elizacloud.ai when clicking the email link (answered by yojo - self-clarification)

Q: Why didn't I receive the $5 welcome credit when clicking the email link? (asked by yojo) A: The email link created a new account on dev.elizacloud.ai with only $1 instead of adding $5 to the existing account (answered by yojo - self-clarification)

## 3. Help Interactions

Helper: Odilitime | Helpee: yojo | Context: Account duplication and missing $5 welcome credit on ElizaCloud platform | Resolution: Offered to receive email via DM and forward issue to Sam for resolution

Helper: sam | Helpee: yojo | Context: Account management and credit allocation issue | Resolution: Confirmed availability to receive DMs directly to help resolve the account problem

## 4. Action Items

Type: Technical | Description: Investigate and fix account duplication issue where email links create separate accounts on dev.elizacloud.ai instead of using existing elizacloud.ai accounts | Mentioned By: yojo

Type: Technical | Description: Resolve missing $5 welcome credit allocation for yojo's account | Mentioned By: yojo

Type: Technical | Description: Fix email link routing to ensure "get started" links direct to production (elizacloud.ai) rather than development environment (dev.elizacloud.ai) | Mentioned By: yojo

Type: Technical | Description: Implement account consolidation for users with duplicate accounts under same email address | Mentioned By: yojo

# Discord Chat Analysis - core-devs Channel

## 1. Summary

The chat segment focused on the production release of Babylon, a game platform with agent-based trading functionality. **puncar** announced the production-ready version and provided detailed onboarding instructions for the team. The access flow requires logging in via babylon.market using ElizaLabs email credentials, which grants admin status and bypasses NFT gating requirements. Users can then access play.babylon.market to interact with agents, trade in the terminal, and explore the feed.

A critical bug was immediately identified during testing. **ziflie** discovered a profile image upload failure that returned a "Failed to update profile" error when attempting to select custom profile images. **puncar** acknowledged and submitted the bug for resolution. **tcm390** implemented and merged a fix for the profile update issue. Post-fix testing by **ziflie** confirmed the issue was resolved successfully.

The team was encouraged to provide feedback through either the integrated green feedback button or direct messages to puncar, and optionally create screen recordings with transcripts using Google Meet to capture the complete end-to-end user experience.

## 2. FAQ

Q: How do I access the Babylon game? (asked by puncar) A: Log in at babylon.market with ElizaLabs email for admin status, then go to play.babylon.market to start playing (answered by puncar)

Q: What can I do in the game? (asked by puncar) A: Spin up agents, talk to them, trade with them in the terminal, and explore the feed (answered by puncar)

Q: How should I provide feedback? (asked by puncar) A: Use the green feedback button on screen or DM puncar directly (answered by puncar)

Q: What error occurs when selecting a custom profile image? (asked by ziflie) A: "Failed to update profile" error message appears (answered by ziflie)

Q: Has the profile update bug been fixed? (asked by tcm390) A: Yes, tested and confirmed working (answered by ziflie)

## 3. Help Interactions

Helper: puncar | Helpee: ziflie | Context: Profile image upload failing with "Failed to update profile" error | Resolution: Bug submitted for fixing

Helper: tcm390 | Helpee: ziflie | Context: Profile update functionality broken | Resolution: Fix merged and deployed, confirmed working by ziflie

# Discord Channel Analysis: üí¨-discussion

## 1. Summary

The discussion centered around three main topics: token migration issues, ElizaOS technical developments, and platform technical support.

**Token Migration Controversy**: A significant portion of the conversation involved users debating the 90-day migration deadline that recently closed. Multiple community members (TanviSinghwal92, V33, Kenk) defended the timeline as sufficient, noting the migration was communicated since March and postponed from October to November. Kenk explained there are ongoing maintenance overheads and human support costs associated with keeping the migration portal open indefinitely, justifying the deadline. Users who missed the deadline were criticized for not monitoring their holdings or opening support tickets before the cutoff.

**ElizaOS Technical Developments**: The project announced cross-chain expansion beyond Solana to Ethereum. The Void confirmed "Elizaos is crosschain now." Discussion highlighted ElizaOS's utility for autonomous agents performing on-chain work, including managing protocol liquidity and orchestrating DeFi workflows, though chomppp questioned when these features would be implemented. The Babylon Monkey game is currently in beta testing for points farming and airdrops.

**Technical Support Issues**: A user (‚àô‚àô¬∑‚ñ´‚ñ´·¥º‚íª‚ìÑ‚ìç‚ìè‚ìé·¥º‚ñ´‚ñ´¬∑‚àô‚àô) reported ElizaCloud login issues where the dashboard kept cycling between login and dashboard screens. Odilitime forwarded this to the cloud team for investigation and requested the user's email via DM for follow-up.

**Community Announcements**: kirsten launched BuildAMolt, a hosted solution for Moltbots and Moltbook on private VPS with 2-minute setup, eliminating the need for local instances. A security matter was raised by memi seeking team contact for private discussion.

Market conditions were briefly discussed, with Arceon noting Bitcoin's drop from 92k to 60k in under 3 weeks, attributing liquidity issues across all cryptocurrencies to capital leaving the market.
